original: Linnarsson, Albert Natanael, fd. rektor, Vadstena, f. 24/4/79 i Falköp. av domprost Josef L. o. Emma Leijon-flycht. G. 08 m. Elsa Nisbeth. Barn: Lennart f. 09, Bengt 12, Kerstin 15. — Stud:ex. 97, fil. kand. i Upp.s. 01, kompl :ex. 04. Res. f. språkstud. t. Tyskl. 02, 05, 22, f. språkstud. t. Engl. 02, 07, m. stip. 13, i övr. (i de flesta fallen s. delt. i OD sångarfärder) t. Norge, Danm., Finl., Tyskl., Österr., Ung., Engl, HolL, Belg., Frankr. OO, 03, 05, 07, 10, 12, 13, 14, 20, 24. Lär. v. Upps. ensk. lärov. o. priv:gymn. 05-07 o. 0i8-10, v. Lundsbergs sk. 07-08, adj. v. Kalmar h. a. 1. 10, v. Upps. j h. a. 1. 23, rektor v. samrealsk. i Vad-I stena 14-44. I Vadstena led. av kyr- koràd 17-40 o. sed. 43, av skolråd 21-40, av stadsfullm. 21-40, ordf. 28-40, av kyrkofullm. 35-40, ordf. där 38-40, av drätselkamm, fr. 44. Ordf. i före-läsn:fören. o. folkhögskifören., led. av direkt, f. Birgittas sjukhus, styr :led. i Motala Ströms Kraft A-B. Skr.: Vadstena lärov. hist. (31), Vadstena Sparb. lOO-års hist. (39). RVO.
translated: Linnarsson, Albert Natanael, former principal, Vadstena, born on April 24, 1879 in Falköping, son of dean Josef L. and Emma Leijon-flycht. Married in 1908 to Elsa Nisbeth. Children: Lennart, born in 1909, Bengt in 1912, Kerstin in 1915. — Graduated from high school in 1897, Bachelor of Arts from Uppsala University in 1901, completed exams in 1904. Traveled for language studies to Germany in 1902, 1905, and 1922, and to England in 1902 and 1907, with a scholarship in 1913, and to other countries (mostly as a participant in cultural tours) such as Norway, Denmark, Finland, Germany, Austria, Hungary, England, the Netherlands, Belgium, and France in the years 1900, 1903, 1905, 1907, 1910, 1912, 1913, 1914, 1920, and 1924. Teacher at Uppsala private gymnasium and high school from 1905-1907 and 1908-1910 respectively, at Lundsberg school from 1907-1908, assistant principal at Kalmar folk high school in 1910, principal at Uppsala folk high school from 1923, principal at the secondary school in Vadstena from 1914-1944. Member of the church council in Vadstena from 1917-1940 and since 1943, member of the local school board from 1921-1940, member of the city council from 1921-1940, chairman from 1928-1940, member of the parish council from 1935-1940, chairman from 1938-1940, member of the finance committee from 1944. Chairman of the lecture association and adult education association, member of the board for Birgitta's hospital, board member of Motala Ströms Kraft AB. Writings: History of Vadstena Gymnasium (1931), 100-year history of Vadstena Savings Bank (1939). Knight of the Royal Order of Vasa.
